name: Metformin
usualDose: Typically 1–2 g/day in divided doses (max 2–3 g/day depending on prep).

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60 mL/min/1.73 m²
renalBands.details: Usual dosing with annual renal monitoring and checks before contrast/surgery.

renalBands.label: eGFR 45–59 mL/min/1.73 m²
renalBands.details: Standard doses often fine; increase monitoring frequency and avoid starting in very high-risk patients.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–44 mL/min/1.73 m²
renalBands.details: Reduce total daily dose (e.g. ~50%) and monitor 3-monthly. Stop during acute illness or dehydration.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30 mL/min/1.73 m²
renalBands.details: Avoid metformin due to lactic acidosis risk; use alternative glucose-lowering strategy.

notes: Stop temporarily for sepsis, dehydration, hypoxia, contrast and major surgery.

name: Gliclazide
usualDose: 40–320 mg/day in 1–2 doses (MR usually once daily).

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use usual titration; monitor for hypoglycaemia.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Lower starting dose and cautious titration; increased risk of prolonged hypos.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–29
renalBands.details: Prefer alternatives; if used, very low doses with close monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15
renalBands.details: Avoid because of significant hypoglycaemia risk.

notes: Warn about driving and hypos, especially as renal function declines.

name: Basal insulin (e.g. insulin glargine)
usualDose: Once or twice daily, fully individualised by glucose profile.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No fixed renal table; insulin requirements usually fall as eGFR declines. Use glucose readings to titrate.

notes: Hypoglycaemia risk rises in CKD; review total insulin dose regularly.

name: Empagliflozin
usualDose: 10–25 mg once daily depending on indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Usual doses for T2DM/HF/CKD as per SPC.

renalBands.label: eGFR 20–59
renalBands.details: For HF/CKD, can often continue or initiate down to eGFR ~20; glucose-lowering effect reduced.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 20
renalBands.details: Often avoid initiating; continuing therapy requires specialist/label-based decision.

notes: Follow SPC and local HF/CKD guidance for exact eGFR cut-offs.

name: Dapagliflozin
usualDose: 10 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use per SPC for T2DM/HF/CKD.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–59
renalBands.details: For HF/CKD indications can often be used down to eGFR ~15; minimal glycaemic effect at lower eGFR.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15
renalBands.details: Usually avoid; refer to SPC and renal/cardiology advice.

notes: Monitor for genital infections, volume depletion and DKA risk.

name: Ramipril
usualDose: 2.5–10 mg once daily depending on indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Titrate to target with creatinine/potassium checks.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Start at low dose and titrate cautiously; stop/tweak if creatinine rises >~30% or K⁺ increases.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–29
renalBands.details: Very low doses with frequent monitoring; consider nephrology/cardiology advice.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15
renalBands.details: Use only on specialist advice.

notes: Apply sick-day rules – hold during dehydration/AKI risk.

name: Lisinopril
usualDose: 5–40 mg once daily depending on indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use usual titration with monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Start at low dose and titrate slowly with U&E checks.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Low-dose use only with close monitoring and often specialist input.

notes: Monitoring strategy similar to ramipril.

name: Losartan
usualDose: 25–100 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Usual doses with U&E monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Start at 25–50 mg and titrate slowly.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Low doses only with frequent monitoring or specialist advice.

notes: ARB monitoring and cautions similar to ACE inhibitors.

name: Candesartan
usualDose: 4–32 mg once daily, indication-dependent.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use usual titration with renal and potassium checks.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Use lower starting doses and titrate carefully.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Low-dose use only with frequent U&E monitoring / specialist advice.

notes: Commonly used in HF; follow local HF titration protocol if available.

name: Bisoprolol
usualDose: Heart failure: 1.25–10 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Titrate per HF/HTN protocol.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Usually no structured dose change, but titrate slowly in frail/CKD.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Monitor closely for bradycardia/hypotension; specialist advice in advanced CKD.

notes: Partly renally cleared; accumulation may contribute to bradycardia in CKD.

name: Furosemide
usualDose: 20–80 mg once or twice daily; higher doses in CKD.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use lowest effective dose with monitoring of U&E and volume status.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: May need higher doses; monitor for AKI and electrolyte disturbance.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–29
renalBands.details: High doses and/or IV often required; usually titrated by HF/renal teams.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Use only with specialist guidance.

notes: Avoid over-diuresis; assess weight, JVP, BP and renal function.

name: Spironolactone
usualDose: HF: typically 25–50 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use usual HF doses with U&E monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR 45–59
renalBands.details: Consider 25 mg on alternate days and closer K⁺ monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–44
renalBands.details: Often avoid or use very low doses with frequent U&E.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Usually avoided outside specialist settings.

notes: Stop or reduce if K⁺ rises or creatinine increases significantly.

name: Atorvastatin
usualDose: 10–80 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Generally no structured dose change; use usual CKD dose recommendations (often 20 mg+ for secondary prevention).

notes: Monitor for myopathy; adjust if CK or symptoms problematic.

name: Simvastatin
usualDose: 10–40 mg once daily in the evening.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Usual doses with routine monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 60
renalBands.details: Often no formal adjustment, but some guidance suggests lower starting doses in advanced CKD.

notes: Be aware of drug interactions and myopathy risk.

name: Apixaban
usualDose: AF: 5 mg twice daily, or 2.5 mg twice daily if dose-reduction criteria.

renalBands.label: CrCl ≥ 50
renalBands.details: Use labelled dose for indication.

renalBands.label: CrCl 30–49
renalBands.details: Often reduced dose in AF if criteria met; check SPC/SPS/local DOAC protocol.

renalBands.label: CrCl 15–29
renalBands.details: AF: usually 2.5 mg bd with caution; VTE often specialist-only decision.

renalBands.label: CrCl < 15 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Most UK guidance: avoid DOACs and consider warfarin or no anticoagulation.

notes: Always use Cockcroft–Gault CrCl, not eGFR, for DOAC dosing.

name: Rivaroxaban
usualDose: AF: 20 mg od with food; 15 mg od if CrCl 15–49.

renalBands.label: CrCl ≥ 50
renalBands.details: Use labelled dose for AF/VTE.

renalBands.label: CrCl 15–49
renalBands.details: AF: 15 mg od; check SPC and SPS for other indications.

renalBands.label: CrCl < 15
renalBands.details: Avoid rivaroxaban; consider alternatives.

notes: Assess bleeding risk and renal function regularly.

name: Edoxaban
usualDose: AF: 60 mg od; 30 mg od if CrCl 15–50, low weight or certain interactions.

renalBands.label: CrCl 50–95
renalBands.details: Use 60 mg od if other reduction criteria not met.

renalBands.label: CrCl 15–49
renalBands.details: Usually 30 mg od; check SPC.

renalBands.label: CrCl < 15
renalBands.details: Avoid edoxaban; use alternative.

notes: Avoid if CrCl > 95 mL/min in AF due to reduced efficacy.

name: Warfarin
usualDose: Highly individualised to INR.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No fixed renal adjustment; dose to INR within target range.

notes: Bleeding risk higher in CKD; monitor INR and interactions closely.

name: Gabapentin
usualDose: 900–3600 mg/day in 3 doses in normal renal function.

renalBands.label: CrCl ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Usual titration up to local max.

renalBands.label: CrCl 30–59
renalBands.details: Reduce total daily dose and/or frequency (e.g. ~600–1800 mg/day).

renalBands.label: CrCl 15–29
renalBands.details: Low doses (e.g. 300–600 mg/day) with slow titration.

renalBands.label: CrCl < 15 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Very low or post-dialysis dosing only.

notes: Accumulation causes sedation/ataxia; use CrCl rather than eGFR if possible.

name: Pregabalin
usualDose: 150–600 mg/day in 2–3 divided doses.

renalBands.label: CrCl ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use usual titration schedule.

renalBands.label: CrCl 30–59
renalBands.details: Lower maximum daily dose (e.g. up to ~300 mg/day).

renalBands.label: CrCl 15–29
renalBands.details: Substantially reduced doses (e.g. up to ~150 mg/day).

renalBands.label: CrCl < 15 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Very low/post-dialysis dosing only.

notes: Accumulation increases sedation, dizziness and oedema; taper slowly when stopping.

name: Sertraline
usualDose: 50–200 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Usually no structured dose change; start low and titrate by response.

notes: Monitor for hyponatraemia, especially in older patients and CKD.

name: Mirtazapine
usualDose: 15–45 mg at night.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 40
renalBands.details: Usual dose range with clinical monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 40
renalBands.details: Consider lower doses and slower titration; monitor for sedation.

notes: Can cause weight gain and sedation; useful for insomnia/poor appetite.

name: Venlafaxine
usualDose: 75–225 mg/day (immediate or modified-release).

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Usual dose range as per BNF.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Reduce total daily dose (e.g. by ~25–50%) and titrate slowly.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Use low doses only and monitor closely; consider alternatives in severe CKD.

notes: Monitor BP and withdrawal symptoms on discontinuation.

name: Amitriptyline
usualDose: 10–75 mg at night for pain (higher for depression under specialist care).

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No formal renal table; start low and titrate by tolerability, particularly in older adults/CKD.

notes: Anticholinergic and cardiac side-effects limit use in frailer CKD patients.

name: Amoxicillin
usualDose: 500 mg tds (higher for severe infection).

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 30
renalBands.details: Usual dose and interval.

renalBands.label: eGFR 10–29
renalBands.details: Reduce frequency (e.g. bd) according to severity and local guidance.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 10 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Lower dose or longer interval; seek renal/microbiology advice in severe infection.

notes: Follow local antimicrobial guidance for indication and exact dosing.

name: Co-amoxiclav
usualDose: 500/125 mg tds or 875/125 mg bd depending on prep.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 30
renalBands.details: Usual dosing per indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR 10–29
renalBands.details: Reduce frequency (e.g. bd) as per BNF/local guidance.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 10 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Consider alternative or further dose/interval reduction with specialist advice.

notes: Monitor LFTs if prolonged course; be aware of cholestatic hepatitis risk.

name: Nitrofurantoin
usualDose: 100 mg MR bd or 50 mg qds for 3–7 days.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 45
renalBands.details: Use for lower UTI only if no upper tract features.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–44
renalBands.details: Some guidance allows short-course use if benefits outweigh risks; avoid prophylaxis.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Avoid due to poor urinary levels and higher toxicity risk.

notes: Avoid in suspected pyelonephritis or sepsis.

name: Trimethoprim
usualDose: 200 mg bd for 3–7 days (acute UTI).

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 30
renalBands.details: Usual short course dosing.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–29
renalBands.details: Reduce total dose or extend interval (e.g. 200 mg od).

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15
renalBands.details: Avoid if possible due to hyperkalaemia and creatinine rise.

notes: Check K⁺ and creatinine if using in patients on ACEI/ARB/spironolactone.

name: Cefalexin
usualDose: 500 mg bd–qds depending on indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 50
renalBands.details: Usual dose and frequency.

renalBands.label: eGFR 10–49
renalBands.details: Reduce frequency (e.g. bd) as per BNF/local guidance.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 10
renalBands.details: Low dose or longer interval; seek renal/micro advice in serious infection.

notes: Watch for neurotoxicity at very low eGFR and high doses.

name: Digoxin
usualDose: 62.5–250 micrograms od according to age, renal function and indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use lower doses in older adults; monitor levels if concern.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Often 62.5–125 micrograms od or on alternate days; check levels if possible.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–29
renalBands.details: Very low doses (e.g. 62.5 micrograms od/alt days); monitor for toxicity.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15
renalBands.details: Dose only with level monitoring and specialist supervision.

notes: Toxicity risk rises in CKD, hypokalaemia and hypomagnesaemia; review interacting drugs.

name: Pioglitazone
usualDose: 15–45 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Dose is not primarily renally determined; use usual doses but avoid fluid overload in HF or advanced CKD.

notes: Monitor weight and oedema; avoid in heart failure or high fracture risk.
Review for bladder cancer risk factors as per SPC/local guidance.

name: Sitagliptin
usualDose: 100 mg once daily in normal renal function.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 50
renalBands.details: 100 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–49
renalBands.details: 50 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–29
renalBands.details: 25 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Use 25 mg once daily with monitoring; check SPC/local guidance.

notes: Low hypoglycaemia risk when used without sulfonylurea/insulin.
Adjust doses of combination products accordingly.

name: Linagliptin
usualDose: 5 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Predominantly non-renal clearance; same dose across eGFR ranges as per SPC.

notes: Low hypoglycaemia risk unless combined with sulfonylurea/insulin.
Useful option in advanced CKD when DPP-4 inhibition is required.

name: Amlodipine
usualDose: 5–10 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Not significantly renally cleared; use usual doses with BP and oedema monitoring.

notes: Peripheral oedema is common; may worsen with advanced CKD.
Avoid abrupt withdrawal in angina.

name: Doxazosin
usualDose: 1–16 mg once daily (or modified-release) depending on indication.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Metabolised hepatically; use usual doses but start low and titrate carefully in older people and CKD.

notes: Monitor for postural hypotension and falls.
Useful as add-on therapy in resistant hypertension.

name: Indapamide
usualDose: 1.5 mg MR once daily or 2.5 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 30
renalBands.details: Usual doses may be used with U&E monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Less effective as a diuretic in eGFR < 30; consider loop diuretic instead for fluid control.

notes: Monitor sodium, potassium and urate.
Use cautiously with other drugs causing hyponatraemia.

name: Bendroflumethiazide
usualDose: 2.5 mg once daily for hypertension (higher doses for oedema).

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 30
renalBands.details: May be used for hypertension with monitoring of electrolytes.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Ineffective as diuretic and increased risk of toxicity; loop diuretic preferred for oedema.

notes: Monitor sodium and potassium, particularly in older adults.
Can increase urate and glucose.

name: Sacubitril / valsartan
usualDose: Target 97/103 mg twice daily after titration from lower strengths.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Start at appropriate strength and titrate to target as tolerated, with close U&E monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Start at lowest strength and titrate cautiously with frequent checks of creatinine and potassium.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–29
renalBands.details: Use only under specialist HF supervision with close U&E monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Generally avoided in severe renal impairment; seek specialist advice.

notes: Must not be co-administered with ACE inhibitors (36-hour washout required).
Monitor for hypotension, hyperkalaemia and renal dysfunction.

name: Aspirin (75 mg for CV prevention)
usualDose: 75 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Low-dose aspirin is not usually renally adjusted, but bleeding risk is higher in CKD.

notes: Consider gastroprotection in high-risk patients.
Use with caution in advanced CKD with bleeding tendency.

name: Clopidogrel
usualDose: 75 mg once daily (after loading dose in ACS/PCI).

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No usual dose change with renal impairment, but bleeding risk is increased in CKD.

notes: Assess bleeding vs thrombotic risk carefully in advanced CKD.
Avoid use with proton pump inhibitors that strongly inhibit CYP2C19 unless necessary.

name: Rosuvastatin
usualDose: 5–40 mg once daily depending on indication and risk.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use labelled dose range with monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Start at low dose (e.g. 5–10 mg) and titrate; higher doses may be used with caution.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Maximum dose is reduced; check SPC/BNF for current maxima (e.g. 10–20 mg).

notes: Monitor for muscle symptoms and CK if indicated.
Consider alternative statin if intolerance.

name: Ezetimibe
usualDose: 10 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No dose change usually required in CKD.

notes: Often used as add-on to statin therapy.
Monitor LFTs when combined with statin.

name: Salbutamol (inhaled)
usualDose: 100–200 micrograms prn by inhaler.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Inhaled doses are not renally adjusted; monitor potassium if frequent high-dose use in CKD.

notes: High-dose nebulised therapy can cause hypokalaemia; monitor in severe CKD/AKI.

name: Tiotropium (inhaled)
usualDose: Once daily inhaled dose according to device.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Usual dose.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 60
renalBands.details: Small increase in systemic exposure; monitor for anticholinergic side effects but usually no dose change.

notes: Use with caution in urinary retention or narrow-angle glaucoma.

name: Budesonide/formoterol (inhaler)
usualDose: Dose depends on strength and MART vs fixed regimen.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Inhaled combination not renally adjusted.

notes: Follow national asthma/COPD guidance for dose selection.
Rinse mouth after use to reduce thrush risk.

name: Omeprazole
usualDose: 20–40 mg once daily depending on indication.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No formal dose change required in CKD.

notes: Long-term use associated with hypomagnesaemia, fractures and C. difficile; review need regularly.

name: Lansoprazole
usualDose: 15–30 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No dose change usually required.

notes: As with other PPIs, periodically review long-term therapy.

name: Loperamide
usualDose: Up to 16 mg/day in divided doses for acute diarrhoea.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Not renally dose-adjusted; avoid in acute colitis and use cautiously in hepatic impairment.

notes: Avoid overuse; investigate underlying cause if symptoms persist.
Risk of serious cardiac events at high doses.

name: Ondansetron
usualDose: 4–8 mg 1–3 times daily orally for nausea/vomiting.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No dose change in mild–moderate renal impairment; in severe CKD usual doses are often used but monitor for QT prolongation.

notes: Use cautiously with other QT-prolonging drugs or electrolyte disturbances.

name: Levothyroxine
usualDose: Individualised; typical maintenance 50–200 micrograms once daily.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No formal renal adjustment; dose to TSH and clinical response.

notes: TSH targets may differ in elderly or cardiac disease.
Take on empty stomach, separate from calcium/iron supplements.

name: Carbimazole
usualDose: 10–40 mg daily in divided doses initially, then titrated.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No formal renal dose change; titrate to thyroid function tests.

notes: Warn about agranulocytosis symptoms (sore throat, fever, mouth ulcers).
Monitor FBC and LFTs if clinically indicated.

name: Alendronic acid
usualDose: 70 mg once weekly (or 10 mg daily) for osteoporosis.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 35
renalBands.details: Usual dose may be used if eGFR is 35 or above.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 35
renalBands.details: Generally avoided when eGFR is below 35 mL/min; consider alternative osteoporosis treatments.

notes: Ensure adequate calcium/vitamin D and correct hypocalcaemia before treatment.
Follow administration instructions to reduce oesophageal irritation.

name: Colecalciferol (vitamin D3)
usualDose: Loading or maintenance regimens vary (e.g. 800–2000 IU daily).

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Dose is guided by vitamin D level and local CKD bone-mineral guidance rather than eGFR alone.

notes: In advanced CKD, activated vitamin D analogues may be required; follow renal team guidance.

name: Sodium valproate
usualDose: Individualised; often 600–2000 mg/day in divided doses.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Not significantly renally cleared; use usual doses but consider lower starting dose in frail CKD.

notes: Serious hepatic, haematological and teratogenic risks; follow MHRA guidance.
Avoid in women of childbearing potential unless absolutely necessary and within Pregnancy Prevention Programme.

name: Lamotrigine
usualDose: Varies by regimen and co-medication; usually 100–400 mg/day.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 30
renalBands.details: Use usual titration schedule guided by seizure control and side effects.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Consider slower titration and lower maintenance doses; monitor for toxicity.

notes: Warn about rash and Stevens–Johnson syndrome.
Check interactions with valproate and enzyme inducers.

name: Levetiracetam
usualDose: 500–3000 mg/day in 2 divided doses in normal renal function.

renalBands.label: CrCl ≥ 80
renalBands.details: Usual dose range according to indication.

renalBands.label: CrCl 50–79
renalBands.details: Slight dose reduction may be considered; check SPC for exact schedules.

renalBands.label: CrCl 30–49
renalBands.details: Further reduce total daily dose; for example 250–750 mg twice daily depending on indication.

renalBands.label: CrCl 15–29
renalBands.details: Lower doses such as 250–500 mg twice daily; check SPC/local guidance.

renalBands.label: CrCl < 15 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Low daily doses with post-dialysis supplementation as per specialist guidance.

notes: Monitor mood and behavioural changes.
Adjust dose promptly if renal function changes.

name: Carbamazepine
usualDose: Usually 400–1200 mg/day in divided doses.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No simple renal table; titrate to clinical response and serum levels if needed, using lower doses in frail CKD.

notes: Enzyme inducer with many interactions; monitor sodium and FBC.
Hyponatraemia is more common in older people and CKD.

name: Quetiapine
usualDose: Wide range depending on indication; e.g. 50–800 mg/day.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No routine renal dose change; start low and titrate carefully in CKD.

notes: Monitor for metabolic syndrome, QT prolongation and sedation.
Use lowest effective dose, particularly in elderly CKD patients.

name: Olanzapine
usualDose: 5–20 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Dose is not routinely adjusted for CKD, but use lower doses and careful titration in frail patients.

notes: High risk of weight gain, metabolic syndrome and sedation.
Monitor glucose and lipids regularly.

name: Risperidone
usualDose: Commonly 2–6 mg/day in divided doses.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Usual dosing range may be used.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 60
renalBands.details: Use reduced starting doses and slower titration in moderate–severe CKD.

notes: Monitor for extrapyramidal symptoms and metabolic effects.
Use carefully in patients with cerebrovascular disease.

name: Tamsulosin
usualDose: 400 micrograms once daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 10
renalBands.details: No usual dose change; monitor postural BP in older adults.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 10
renalBands.details: Limited data in very severe CKD; use with caution and monitor.

notes: May cause postural hypotension; advise patients about dizziness/falls.
Can contribute to intraoperative floppy iris syndrome in cataract surgery.

name: Finasteride
usualDose: 5 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No dose change typically required in CKD.

notes: PSA falls by about 50% on treatment; interpret results accordingly.
Teratogenic to male fetus; women of childbearing potential should avoid handling crushed tablets.

name: Oxybutynin
usualDose: 2.5–5 mg two to three times daily (or modified-release once daily).

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No standard dose adjustment but start low and titrate with caution in frail CKD patients.

notes: Anticholinergic burden is significant; consider alternatives in older people with CKD.
Monitor for cognitive impairment and constipation.

name: Mirabegron
usualDose: Usually 50 mg once daily (25 mg in some groups).

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: 50 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: 50 mg once daily usually acceptable; some patients may start at 25 mg if frail or on interacting drugs.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–29
renalBands.details: Maximum 25 mg once daily as per SPC in moderate renal impairment with certain risk factors.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Generally avoid in severe renal impairment; check SPC for exact restrictions.

notes: Can raise blood pressure; avoid uncontrolled hypertension.
Useful alternative when antimuscarinics are poorly tolerated.

name: Amoxicillin
usualDose: 250–500 mg three times daily (higher in severe infections).

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 30
renalBands.details: Use usual dosing.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Reduce dosing frequency (e.g. 500 mg twice daily).

notes: Generally well tolerated; adjust dosing in severe impairment.
Safe in pregnancy and breastfeeding.

name: Co-amoxiclav
usualDose: 500/125 mg three times daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 30
renalBands.details: Usual dose can be used.

renalBands.label: eGFR 10–29
renalBands.details: Consider 500/125 mg twice daily (BNF-based).

renalBands.label: eGFR < 10
renalBands.details: 500/125 mg once daily or specialist advice depending on severity.

notes: Avoid the 875 mg strength in CKD due to accumulation risk.
Monitor LFTs with prolonged use.

name: Phenoxymethylpenicillin (Pen V)
usualDose: 250–500 mg four times daily depending on indication.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No dose adjustment usually required.

notes: Preferred for tonsillitis/erysipelas in adults and children.

name: Flucloxacillin
usualDose: 500 mg four times daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 10
renalBands.details: Usual dose is appropriate.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 10
renalBands.details: No formal renal adjustment but monitor hepatic function and for neurotoxicity in severe renal failure.

notes: Useful for cellulitis and MSSA infections.
Take on an empty stomach for better absorption.

name: Clarithromycin
usualDose: 250–500 mg twice daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 30
renalBands.details: Usual dosing allowed.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Reduce dose by 50% or increase dosing interval.

notes: Major CYP3A4 interactions; check carefully.
QT prolongation risk increases in CKD.

name: Azithromycin
usualDose: 500 mg once daily for 3 days (or other regimens depending on indication).

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No formal adjustment required.

notes: Use caution with QT-prolonging drugs.
Less CYP interaction than clarithromycin.

name: Doxycycline
usualDose: 200 mg day 1 then 100 mg daily.

renalBands.label: All renal function
renalBands.details: Preferred tetracycline in CKD as elimination is non-renal.

notes: Avoid in pregnancy & in children under 12.
Minimise sun exposure.

name: Ciprofloxacin
usualDose: 250–500 mg twice daily depending on indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use usual dose.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Reduce dose (e.g. 250 mg twice daily or extend interval).

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Reduce further – check BNF/SPC.

notes: Tendinopathy risk increased in CKD, older adults & steroid use.
QT prolongation risk.

name: Nitrofurantoin
usualDose: 100 mg twice daily (or 50 mg four times daily).

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 45
renalBands.details: Usual dosing can be used.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–44
renalBands.details: Short-course (3–7 days) may be used for lower UTI only if benefits outweigh risks (MHRA).

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Ineffective and risk of toxicity; avoid.

notes: Not for upper UTI or pyelonephritis.
Check local UTI guidelines.

name: Trimethoprim
usualDose: 200 mg twice daily for 3 days.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 30
renalBands.details: Use usual dose.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Reduce dose/frequency; avoid if possible due to hyperkalaemia risk.

notes: Hyperkalaemia risk increased in CKD and with ACEi/ARB/spironolactone.
Avoid in pregnancy.

name: Metronidazole
usualDose: 400 mg twice or three times daily.

renalBands.label: All renal function
renalBands.details: Use usual dosing.

notes: Reduce dose only in severe hepatic impairment.
Avoid alcohol due to disulfiram-like reaction.

name: Cefalexin
usualDose: 250–500 mg every 6–8 hours.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 50
renalBands.details: Usual dosing.

renalBands.label: eGFR 10–49
renalBands.details: Reduce frequency (e.g. 500 mg twice daily).

renalBands.label: eGFR < 10
renalBands.details: Lower dose or interval; check BNF/SPC.

notes: Good for pregnancy-safe UTI and SSTI.
May cause GI upset.

name: Aciclovir
usualDose: 200–800 mg depending on indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 50
renalBands.details: Usual dose.

renalBands.label: eGFR 25–49
renalBands.details: Reduce frequency (e.g. every 12 hours).

renalBands.label: eGFR 10–24
renalBands.details: Increase interval (e.g. every 24 hours).

renalBands.label: eGFR < 10
renalBands.details: Use extended intervals; check SPC.

notes: Hydrate well to reduce crystalluria risk.
Neurotoxicity risk increases in severe CKD.

name: Valaciclovir
usualDose: 500 mg twice daily for HSV; higher for VZV.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 50
renalBands.details: Usual dose.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–49
renalBands.details: Reduce frequency.

renalBands.label: eGFR 10–29
renalBands.details: Lower dose/frequency based on indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 10
renalBands.details: Marked dose reduction required; check SPC.

notes: Better oral bioavailability than aciclovir.
Hydration important.

name: Prednisolone
usualDose: Varies by indication.

renalBands.label: All renal ranges
renalBands.details: Steroid doses depend on indication, not renal function.

notes: Monitor BP, glucose, mood and infection risk.
Taper slowly after long-term use.

name: Methotrexate
usualDose: 7.5–25 mg once weekly.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Usual weekly dose may be used with monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Consider 50–70% of usual dose; monitor FBC, LFTs and eGFR closely.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Avoid due to risk of severe toxicity (myelosuppression).

notes: Ensure folic acid supplementation.
Never take daily — weekly only.

name: Allopurinol (alternative entry)
usualDose: 100–300 mg daily, titrated.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: May use standard titration.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Start with 50–100 mg daily; titrate to urate.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Use with extreme caution; hypersensitivity risk increased.

notes: Separate duplicate entry optional – delete if unwanted.
Check HLA-B*5801 in high-risk ethnic groups if available.
